segments.text: I notice the woman standing there, completely absorbed in her task, and it’s almost mesmerizing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own little world while everything else crumbles around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sight of that water overflowing makes my stomach drop; she should really see it!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it hard to believe she can’t hear the water splashing, it’s deafening!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the boy is climbing dangerously high on that unstable stool, stretching for the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout, to warn them, but somehow it feels like they’re in a playful bubble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s anticipation is so pure, her arms raised like she’s expecting to fly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so innocent, yet they’re both conspiring in this little heist behind the woman’s back.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about the mess that will surely happen if that boy falls; it sends a chill through me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kitchen is a juxtaposition of calmness from outside and chaos inside, and I just can’t take my eyes off it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Seeing the cookies just within reach makes the moment feel even more daring.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can imagine the sweetness of the cookies melting in their mouths as they laugh, if only they get to them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But what of the water? What of the disaster waiting to happen?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a strange dance of lightheartedness and danger, and I feel both drawn in and alarmed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish I could intervene, to shake the woman out of her trance, to make her see the reality around her.
segments.speaker: PAR
